sentences.en: [with clause]God forbid that this should happen to anyone ever again.
sentences.cn: 上帝不容这类事在任何人身上重演。

sentences.en: God forbid that he should injure you!
God forbid that I should ever have to work with him again.
sentences.cn: 但愿我不必再与他共事.

sentences.en: God forbid that I should tell you to harden your hearts.
sentences.cn: 上帝不容我对各位说要心狠手辣.

sentences.en: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
sentences.cn: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.en: Heaven forbid that anything awful should have happened to her.
Heaven forbid that he should leave because of me!
sentences.cn: 但愿他不会因为我而离开！

sentences.en: I can't forbid you / your seeing that man again.
sentences.cn: 我无法禁止你再和那个男人来往.

sentences.en: I forbid you the use of my tape recorder.
sentences.cn: 我不许你用我的录音机.

sentences.en: If you want to go, Ican't forbid you.
sentences.cn: 你想去, 我也拦不住你.

sentences.en: If, God forbid, something goes wrong, I don't know what I would do.
sentences.cn: 如果哪儿出点儿岔子，我会不知所措的，但愿这样的事情不会发生。

sentences.en: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
sentences.cn: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

sentences.en: My feelings in every respect forbid it.
sentences.cn: 我感情上怎么也办不到.

sentences.en: The bylaws forbid playing ball in the public garden.
sentences.cn: 地方法规规定任何人不得在公园打球或踢球.

sentences.en: They forbid any ships to enter the water.
sentences.cn: 他们禁止任何船舶进入这片水域.

words.tran_cn: 被禁止的；严禁的，禁用的
令人生畏的；严峻的；险恶的

phrases.tran_cn: 上帝（天）不容（表达不希望发生某事的强烈愿望）

trans.tran_en: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed
to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed
